author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Plachimada Anti-Coca Cola Agitation Committee, comprising members of over 900 tribal and Dalit families of Perumatti and Pattanchery panchayats here, will organise a protest in Thiruvananthapuram on February 11 during Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh’s visit to the State capital.

Committee chairman Vilayodi Venugopal said the protest was meant to convey the growing resentment against the Union Home Ministry’s role in the President returning the Plachimada Coca-Cola Victims Relief and Compensation Claims Special Tribunal Bill passed unanimously by the Kerala Assembly in 2011.

Mr. Venugopal demanded that the State government pass another law that would not require forwarding it for presidential assent. The committee and others were planning large-scale protests to ensure justice to the victims.
title: Plachimada victims to protest during Rajnath’s visit
